intro: Telipogon nitens, commonly known as the slender clubmoss, is a small evergreen plant belonging to the family Lepidoziaceae. It is native to the temperate regions of South America, particularly in Chile and Argentina. The plant grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rock crevices. It has a compact, low-growing habit with closely packed, needle-like leaves. Telipogon nitens is characterized by its unique reproductive structures, including small, club-shaped sporangia that produce spores for propagation.
